title: No, the Supreme Court has not yet given any verdict on Lord Ram’s birthplace or Mandir’s construction
subtitle: The Supreme Court did not give any verdict in the Ram Mandir and Ayodhya case. The verdict is expected to come by 17th November.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A post is being shared on Facebook with a claim that the Supreme Court has given a judgment that Ayodhya is Lord Ram’s birthplace and the construction of Ram Mandir would commence from 5th November. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post. 



Claim: Supreme Court: “Ayodhya is Lord Ram’s birthplace. Ram Mandir to be built from 5th November.” Fact: The Supreme Court did not give any verdict in the Ayodhya case. The verdict is expected to come by 17th November. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.

When searched about the issue on Google with the keywords “ayodhya ram mandir to be built from november 5”, no relevant information was found in the search results. In an article by India Today, it was found that a Rajasthan BJP MLA has claimed that the Ram Mandir will be built by 17th November. Currently, the Supreme Court is hearing arguments by different sides and these will be wrapped by 17th October. The judgment is expected to come by 17th November. 



To sum it up, the SC has not yet given any verdict on Lord Ram’s birthplace or Mandir’s construction.
